author: A_Brickset_user
title: Awesome little street sweeper!
review: Basically, this set is incredible for its size, because it has 2 figs in which Lego could easily just only have one of them; plus the minifigs are great. :) It has a nice scooper in the back, a nice trans-clear sloped windscreen which I prefer over a trans-light blue one. Overall, its all good! :)

author: justrock
title: Sweeping Mania!
review:
I find it pretty funny that this is one of several street sweepers that have come out over the years. Who knew there was such a demand? Then again, I got this one after all...
Some other models look a little better, but at least this one had two figures to get the job done.

author: Blade
title: LEGO Town is  a Clean Town
review:
Another one of my old classics I got when I was really young. We don't have anything like this here in Australia so I always thought it was awesome. The model is well designed with great features. The front sweeper turns side to side and moves up and down. The top has an opening sunroof and a vacuum on the side. The back has a scoop shovel for sweeping rubbish into the compartment. Tail lights, top flashing light, opening doors and twin mini-figs make this model an absolute gem.

The mini-figs are in blue suits with white caps. They also have a brown broom each. Their faces are the plain standard faces.

Overall a great model with no flaws and a must for all LEGO towns. I feel this model is a 7/10 and very suited to any old school collector or a lover of the town series. A must have.

author: asianlego
title: The Previous Street Sweeper
review:
This vehicle is responsible for paving way to our modern Street Sweeper that most of us City lovers have today. Even though the newer version received better response and ratings from fans, this version has more charm to it. First, it comes with two minifigs. There is nothing better than receiving two minifigs when you know only one can drive the Street Sweeper. Also I wish they retained the sunroof in this version on the newer version. They took it off to maintain realisticness, true, because why would street sweepers need a sunroof? Also this Street Sweeper has a yellow/red color scheme while the new one has an all-yellow color scheme. 

-asianlego

author: MIDAS
title: A classic that deserves more attention than it has.
review:
This set is one of the few older sets i have, growing up with siblings who also like LEGO, and personally, it's one of my favourites.

The simplicity is what does it for me, few pieces, but lots of functionality, detail, and just a decent build overall. There are very few flaws, a trait few sets have, and i just feel it has what a set needs. Pro's and Cons;

  • Pros:
  • Great looking set
  • Nice minfigs - two is impressive, even if they're the same
  • Lot's to do, vacuum, sweeper, a man with a brush, and even a dirt collector round back
  • Window's look great
  • Actual doors!
  • Cons:
  • Hard to open front as seems to be intended, often takes steering wheel with it!

Definitely one I'd recommend, a great addition to any city, classic or modern, and a great set to have in general.
